keyword: how many calories in an mre
title: How Many Calories in an MRE?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in an MRE, including full nutrition breakdown like carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and variations for different menus.
h1: How Many Calories in an MRE?
assumptions: Standard US military MRE (full meal kit including entree, sides, dessert, beverage mix; average across menus).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by MRE menu, manufacturer, expiration date, and components consumed. Check packaging for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard MRE provides about 1250 kcal, designed for high energy in field conditions.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add supplemental snack pack (e.g., energy bar)

faqs.q: How many calories in an MRE typically?
faqs.a: Around 1200-1300 kcal per full MRE, averaging 1250 kcal.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in an MRE?
faqs.a: Approximately 45 g of protein per MRE.

faqs.q: Why is sodium so high in MREs?
faqs.a: For flavor and preservation in field conditions; about 4000 mg per MRE.

faqs.q: Do all MREs have the same calories?
faqs.a: No, varies by menuâ€”some beef entrees higher, vegetarian lower.

faqs.q: How do MRE carbs break down?
faqs.a: About 170 g total carbs, with 15 g fiber and 40 g sugars.
